wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Johns (26 November 1836 – 1914) was a Welsh Independent (Congregationalist) minister, best known for his pastorate at Capel Als, Llanelli, one of the largest chapels in Wales, from 1869 until his death in 1914.

Tabernacle was established as a result of a decision by the members of Capel Als to establish a new church because the ir on chapel could not accommodate all those ho wished to attend services. The minister, Thomas Johns, noted that a large number of members lived in the western part of the town an it was therefore decided to establish a new church closer to their homes. The foundation stone was laid on Good Friday 1873 on land donated by Sir John Stepney MP. The chapel opened on Easter Sunday two years later, when Thomas Johns preached the first sermon in the new chapel. By the end of the year, Tabernacle had 502 members.
The minister from 1869 until 1914 was Thomas Johns, a leading figure in Welsh nonconformity,
